website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router WNDR3300 is a basic Wireless-N router that only offers a taste of dual-band wireless networking. Its short range and limited feature set may override its decent mixed-mode performance.
pros: good mixed mode and range throughput speed
cons: no print serving or NAS functionality, no USB

customer_reviews.title: Needs DD-WRT Firmware
customer_reviews.text: The original router is crap. I kept having problems with the router dropping signals or only being able to connect 1 wireless device at a time. So after much tinkering with the settings in the router and getting nowhere i found out there is better 3rd party firmware available called dd-wrt. After installing DD-WRT firmware the router is fantastic no dropped signals at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Dual band rules
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dual band wireless router. It has a G antenna and an N antenna. It increases speed between two computers when one is using the N band and the other is using the G, because they don't have to share the same one and divide the bandwidth. I've had this unit for about a year and I'm very happy with the range, reliability and ease of use. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Pechiu

customer_reviews.title: Probably one of the best routers i have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this model of router for 5 years, it has never had any flaws. I ordered a second one recently since I wanted to extend the wireless range of it. Wireless G had good range. But, like almost any other N router, the N band is weak. But VERY reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Bradyn

customer_reviews.title: Weak signal, drops constantly
customer_reviews.text: I don't think it is too much to ask that a router be able to cover a 1600 sq. ft. one level home (no plaster walls) with a decently strong signal. I also think it would be rather expected that a router could manage a solid hour or two with no drops. If you have similar expectations, do not buy this router.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Because I ordered one and applied the dd-wrt firmware and it did not do good. It did not accomplish the function of a ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is a 50-50. Why? Because I ordered one and applied the dd-wrt firmware and it did not do good. It did not accomplish the function of a range extender. So, I ordered a 2nd one and that 2nd one did just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Mancillas

customer_reviews.title: Fast reliable router. No more drop outs on Linksys ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast reliable router. No more drop outs on Linksys products.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Neath

customer_reviews.title: Don't Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The router continuously drops the connection and did not work well with my PS3 (through a wired connection) at all. I ended up going back to my Linksys b/g router. I eventually purchased an Apple Airport Express, which I would recommend although slightly more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Used as a repeater
customer_reviews.text: Used this router as a repeater paired to the ADSL wireless router, it didn't provide WPA protection when in that mode, only plain unsecured connections. The range wasn't that big either.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 2 months ago. After a reboot, it will work good for a short while, but speed will decrease as the minutes go on. I bought this off of Amazon as a refurb, and after checking many different forums, realized that the issue I was having, many many other people had also. After 2 months, am realizing that I am in the market for another router.
customer_reviews.author: K. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: ok product
customer_reviews.text: this product is very easy to use as is any other push to connect router. i bought this for the 5ghz band which doesnt seem to have as far of a range as 2.4ghz. this may just be my experience but on all my devices i get a stronger signal with the 2.4ghz connection. lights are very bright and go crazy flashing but can easily be turned off
customer_reviews.author: wwyatt

customer_reviews.title: Wireless technology is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: How amazing to transfer information through air?! I am able to do away with 50 foot cord running through apartment. I have only computer connected but hope to do more with it. The light on top glows bright in dark but press down and light turns off.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN HAWKINS

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product was a good buy. It was easy to install, having to go online to get the directions was not a problem because my netbook picked up the unsecured wireless signal as soon a the router was cut on. A salesperson at a computer store told me that it was extremely complicated to make the signal a secured one and that I would have to pay a professional to come out and do it, but I was able to do it myself with no problem. The direction are very clear and easy.
customer_reviews.author: L. McClendon

customer_reviews.title: VARY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A GREAT DEAL. WORKS VARY WELL. I HAVE HAD THIS PRODUCT FOR SEVERAL MONTHS AND IT WORKS WITHOUT FLAW.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable: Drops every 30min
customer_reviews.text: Has been the bane of my home network. Old G router was fine. If you like troubleshooting technology, buy one of these or go work for Netgear, they need help.
customer_reviews.author: Dug

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: Dual Band, B/G/N, 2.4 and 5 GHz. Two radios. I immediately installed dd-wrt software. They work great as APs or paired as a bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wright

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, reliable (until it dies)
customer_reviews.text: Works well until it no longer works (like several wireless Netgear routers before)
customer_reviews.author: svenf

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, returned the one I bought for $100 to Staples, and got this one, Happy with the first one, and happier with this one
customer_reviews.author: Jonas J. Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Nice router with decent range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router because I recently upgraded my network to wireless N. This router is easy to set up and provides decent signal range(could be better though). I have not yet tried the 5Ghz range. Using the N standard, it definitely increases transfer speeds which is a plus to me. Overall a great router and would choose Netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: baker2010k

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These work great! We placed them around our school & we have had great success with our wi-fi connection. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Day

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: So far this router has worked better than I expected. I wanted to stream movies from NetFlix without interruption and that's what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Dean A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Got this router toe expand my wifi signal but it doesn't always expand it far enough. It works when it wants to but good overall for small houses or apartments.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Best, cheap, aftermarket supported router
customer_reviews.text: This router runs DD-WRT very easily. It's dirt cheap. And it supports wireless N. If it had a gigabyte hub, it would be about perfect, but it would also probably cost 4 times as much. I don't know how the stock software works, but flashing it with DD-WRT is easy and it works great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K and B

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to set-up and use. Range is slightly better than my old router. I've only had one problem with it. Once it completely stopped working -- couldn't connect to the internet at all. I just unplugged it and plugged it back in and it started working again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The product was shipped quickly and functions well. The only thing I would note is, that although the listing noted that instructions were not included and that instructions could be found online at the main website, the exact location of the instructions may have been more helpful as it took me some time to find them off the main website page.
customer_reviews.author: K. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: No problem setting up
customer_reviews.text: Basically plugged it in and ready to go. Did have a little problem setting up between ranges but didn't take me over 15 minutes. Decide to use "G" based on other reviews.My son plays online PS3 game using wireless in next room and has had no problem with drop outs.
customer_reviews.author: twalls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these and I was very much satisfide with this unit
customer_reviews.author: Robert F Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It is as discribed, no problems internet is now upper fast. Duel band was need for my windows 8 computer to work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Gove

customer_reviews.title: wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! the range is very good. I can go to my driveway, to the garage, outside on the front porch and back and it works wonderfully! very much worth!
customer_reviews.author: I. Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Should of went with Netgear first
customer_reviews.text: Linksys cisco router would not work correctly,and linksys would not provid firmware update. My friend recommend this,and I love it. Great product
customer_reviews.author: ILikeTech

customer_reviews.title: Range Max WNDR3300 Router
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up and we have had no problems thus far. Would recommend this product and purchase from Amazon to others.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Hallenbeck

customer_reviews.title: NetGear Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 to 6 different brands of routers over the past 6 years and was unhappy with the time it took to set them up. Went to the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas last year and spent an entire day going from booth to booth checking out routers and through the house wiring adapters. NetGear had them both and the 3300 looks good, performs well, and has the easiest set up. Since I was a small merchant, the rep suggested that I purchase from Amazon and I have been happy ever since.
customer_reviews.author: John Krause

customer_reviews.title: Ideal router for multipurpose use at the same time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wireless router (refurbished) in excellent condition and it works well with my nanny cam/ internet phone and online videos at the same time with very good speed and quality. I am happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: mubamemon

customer_reviews.title: Out Standing Router
customer_reviews.text: I had an HP tech hook this router up to my new hp computer, and wow. This router far exceeded my expectations, and it also looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Lander Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Netgear makes great product. Unit worked great for my home. However, need to add range extention for upstairs in order for the signal to be received upstairs
customer_reviews.author: David Walker Jr

customer_reviews.title: netgear router
customer_reviews.text: This netgear router is everything it was advertised to be. The range goes all the way through my house now and I even have a sign while I am sitting on my back patio.
customer_reviews.author: raiderray

customer_reviews.title: Netgear DUAL band N300 router
customer_reviews.text: I bought his product from Amazon, have not used it for a while. I finally decided to replace my old Linksys router with netgear one. I had trouble logging into the netgear router using the default login creadentials given in the documentation. I called customer support and the representative instead of helping with simple issue, wanted me to pay for it, since the purchase was done over 90 days. The guy has horrible attitude, lacking basic attitude to help customers. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SUPPORT. PLEASE STAY AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: CHANDRA BABBURI

customer_reviews.title: Speedy Delivery, Product just as described
customer_reviews.text: This purchase arrived quite fast. I wasn't expecting it so quickly. I am pleased with the router so far. It was in good working order and very clean. As a matter fact, looked better than I imagined. I would recommend buying from seller again.
customer_reviews.author: spring

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this routed 'used' so I was expecting a few scratches etc on the casing. I was actually impressed how good the condition was externally. However, the previous owner had replaced the OEM firmware with an open source provider "dd-wrt" and I have been working for weeks now to restore it to the OEM version. No luck so far and I'm about to turn it into a boat archor. I think the firmware replacement should have been communicated. As it is, I feel like I bought someone else's problem that they couldn't fix. I won't buy "used" again and I'd seriously consider using Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gravely

customer_reviews.title: it was a 2009 build, the c/d does not ...
customer_reviews.text: it was a 2009 build, the c/d does not work on windows 7 ,netgear is giving me a hard time over 2009 build date. Want proof of purchase... may return unit .have return label dave Henry 1-432=263-1862 home 1-432-213-0666 cell
customer_reviews.author: DAVE HENRY

customer_reviews.title: Item burned out after a power surge in our home ...
customer_reviews.text: Item burned out after a power surge in our home. Had to replace it with a new one. No more purchasing of used electronic items.
customer_reviews.author: Juan-Manuel Valera Jr

customer_reviews.title: The little Netgear Router that wouldn't
customer_reviews.text: This was a great looking product. Installation, however, was a bust. The Netgear technical support person hadn't a clue as to how to really help me. Had me doing the same thing over and over. They did NOT know how to reset my cable modem - wherein lay the problem. If they had known they could have avoided a product return and this bad review.
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: Expeditiously shipped
customer_reviews.text: I received this item within days after ordering @ very easy installation. Product works great!!
customer_reviews.author: H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: No 5 Ghz with Linksys WPC600N
customer_reviews.text: First one (Refurb) was DOA (All lights flashing) Second works, but I haven't been able to get my dual band Linksys WPC600N card bus to work on the 5 Ghz band. The latest drivers for it are rather old (2007) so I'm not sure it's the fault of Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J. Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Founding this router was a life saver! We was having issues with our old router and this when came quickly. It was easy to setup and the range of it is strong and long range.
customer_reviews.author: Assmus04

customer_reviews.title: inexcusable shipping method.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second router of it's kind that I have, so it meets my expectations as far as the actual product goes. It cane in a thin white envelope without any protective materials what-so-ever. No registration or appropriate materials for the unit. For a new unit, without packaging or manufacturer data sheets, such delivery hit an all time low. I won't purchase from that seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

product_meta.title: NETGEAR WNDR3300 RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router
product_meta.description:
What is NETGEAR¿s WNDR3300 RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router? ¿ Surf, email, stream HD video, on-line game, make Internet phone calls¿simultaneously¿ ¿ More wireless channels, less interference and better connections using dual band Wireless-N ¿ Wirelessly connect new devices easily and securely with Push `N¿ Connect ¿ Automatically adjusts to the needs of Internet, voice, video and gaming applications (QoS) ¿ Use with a RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Adapter and boost your performance and range Features ¿ New Wireless-N technology delivers exceptional range and speed ¿ ¿Dual Band¿ has more channels, less interference and better connections ¿ Works with older Wireless-G and newest Wireless-N devices at the same time ¿ ¿Push `N¿ Connect¿ wirelessly connects new devices easily and securely ¿ No need to remember your security password ¿ For use with other Push `N¿ Connect supported devices ¿ Easy setup with Smart Wizard® installation CD

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The NETGEAR RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router (WNDR3300) effectively creates two separate but simultaneous wireless networks in your home or office--one that supports older Wireless-G products, and one for the newer, more robust Wireless N standards. The router's "dual" nature lets you continue to use your existing Wireless-G devices while giving you the advantage of the vastly improved throughput speed, range and performance of a Wireless-N network.

 

RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router features:
 * Blazing speeds and extended range thanks to Wireless-N technology.
 * Backwards compatibility with Wireless-G devices.
 * Double firewall security and parental controls.
 * Quality of Service for automatic prioritization of tasks.



With its dual band nature, you can create two separate but simultaneous wireless networks. View larger. And when used with computers and devices with Wireless-N capability, the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router will let you surf, email, stream HD video, play on-line games, and even make Internet phone calls simultaneously, avoiding annoying interference from neighboring Wi-Fi networks and other wireless devices like Bluetooth or cordless phones. Dual Band Wireless-N: Less Interference, Increased Range and Superior Performance
Featuring the latest dual band Wireless-N technology, the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router delivers exceptional range and speed for new Wireless-N devices while still offering backwards compatibility to older Wireless-G devices. 

 NETGEAR's unique multiple internal antenna technology packs eight metamaterial antennas into this wireless router. This enables wireless signals to travel farther for a stronger, more reliable wireless connection. This new technology also minimizes "dead spots" that can frustrate wireless network users.

 While performance will vary according to your particular conditions, when used with other Wireless-N computers and devices, the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router can deliver up to 10 times the range of older Wireless-G routers and offer a throughput speed of up to 15 times faster.

 (For optimal performance, the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router should be used with NETGEAR's RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Adapter or laptops with integrated Wireless-N)

 



Push 'N' Connect makes set up a cinch. Easy Set-Up with Push 'N' Connect
Setting up and connecting to the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router couldn't be easier. The router comes with a Smart Wizard installation CD that vastly simplifies the initial set-up process by automatically detecting and configuring your router for virtually all ISP connections.  And once your network is set up, the router's "Push 'N' Connect" feature takes over. To connect a new device on your network, you simply push a button on the router, and your device is automatically and securely configured and connected to your wireless network.

 This means that the days of having to remember complicated security keys and passwords are over. The router also features an integrated switch that lets you attach up to four devices directly to the router.

 Another notable advantage of dual band Wireless-N is that it works with up to 23 channels that operate on the 5GHz band. Wireless-G networks, on the other hand, operate on the 2.4-GHz band with only 3 channels, which is also home to some cordless phones, microwaves, and other devices that can cause interference. 5GHz Wireless-N avoids the interference that can interrupt Wireless-G networks, giving you greater reliability and performance.

 And the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router "dual" nature means the router creates both Wireless-G and Wireless-N networks at the same time. So on your Wireless-N enabled computer, you'll see two networks to choose from, depending on your usage.

 For instance, if you're using your network for streaming HD movies or VoIP, you can connect over the Wireless-N network and use the Wireless-G for less demanding applications, such as connecting to your printer or sending email.

 And thanks to its QoS, or Quality of Service, the router will automatically prioritize its tasks according to your network's existing bandwidth and your needs. So if you're playing an online game, or streaming an HD video while someone else on your network starts downloading a large file, the router helps ensure that your games and video won't be interrupted.

 



Four ports let you connect via ethernet cable. Parental Controls and Security at Home
The RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router offers double firewall protection that includes network address translation, or NAT, to keep you network hidden from outside users, and stateful packet inspection, or SPI, firewall to deny outside requests for personal information. Other security measures include denial-of-service (DoS) attack prevention, intrusion detection and prevention (IDS), and Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA2-PSK, WPA-PSK). The router offers both 64-bit and 128-bit encryption as well as a wireless access control that identifies authorized wireless network devices connected to your network.

 For parental peace of mind, the RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router offers several options designed to keep your kids safe, including URL content filtering, time-based usage controls, and "trusted user" controls. The router's remote management controls make it easy to keep your kids online and protected.

 The RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router measures 8.8 x 6.0 x 1.2 inches (HxWxD) and comes with a 1-year manufacturer's warranty.

 What's in the Box
RangeMax Dual Band Wireless-N Router (WNDR3300), stand, Ethernet cable, setup CD, 12V 1.5A power adapter, and warranty/support information card.

feature_bullets: Wireless N dual band router operates on both 5 GHz and 2.4-GHz bands for optimal performance
Surf, email, stream HD video, play on-line games, and make Internet phone calls simultaneously without interference from other Wi-Fi networks
Delivers up to 10 times the range of Wireless-G routers and offers throughput speeds of up to 15 times faster
Measures 8.8 x 6.0 x 1.2 inches (HxWxD); 1-year manufacturer's warranty
